message.content:
In JavaScript, it is not possible to directly write to a user's local files due to security reasons. However, there are workarounds that can be used to achieve this functionality. Here are some examples:

1. Using the FileSaver.js library: https://github.com/eligrey/FileSaver.js/

2. Using the download attribute in an anchor tag: https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_a_download.asp

3. Using the Blob object and creating a URL for it: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Blob
